page.title: 15KILWINNING ABBEY
page.content: {KILWINNING ABBEY}-these fine buildings ,now alas in ruins are all that is left of the great Abbey.The monks came with {ST. WINNING}(thought to be a teacher of ST.COLUMBA)and established a base about the year 640.Somewhere around 1160 a local landowner,one of the Normans who came to rule Scotland, {SIR HUGH de MORVILLE gave money to {build the great KILWINNING ABBEY.}The{ {GABLE }of the south transept,the south wall of the nave,the arched gateway from the cloisters into the nave,the remains of the charter house and the { tower arch of the nave survived. {ABBEY parish church is a busy thriving {church }with a hall nearby.The present {church,built in 1774,}and the {BELL {TOWER }stand beside the ruins.The BELL TOWER was rebuilt in 1816 after it had been struck by lightning and fell down.The bell rings out each Sunday.
